text: Amateur film of the commercial harvesting of ice, using horse and man powered equipment, at Pocono Manor in 1919 Pocono Manor is an unincorporated community in Monroe County, Pennsylvania, United States, located at approximately latitude 41.1 and longitude -75.359, at an elevation of 1,706 feet, on Pennsylvania Route 314 east of Pocono Summit and west of Swiftwater.http://pennsylvania.hometownlocator.com/pa/monroe/pocono-manor.cfm Pocono is a Native American name purported to mean "a stream between two mountains". Pocono Manor was the location of a resort and golf course called The Inn at Pocono Manor, with a Donald Ross-designed golf course,Golf at The Inn at Pocono Manor site of the Pocono Northeast Classic; and Pocono Manor Historic District. Pocono Manor Inn was burned down on November 2, 2019. The cause of the fire is still under investigation. ==References== Category:Pocono Mountains Category:Unincorporated communities in Monroe County, Pennsylvania Category:Unincorporated communities in Pennsylvania Category:Articles containing video clips
title: Pocono Manor, Pennsylvania
